prerequisite: It would be helpful to have background in macroeconomics, but not necessary.
moduleDescription: In recent years, China has emerged as a major global economic power. Moreover, China has become increasingly integrated with the rest of the global economy. It is important for the students to have a good understanding on the past, present and future of the Chinese economy. This course is intended to provide students with an intensive overview of the Chinese economy with focus on the major processes of institutional change and policy debates since 1978.
faculty: LEE KUAN YEW SCHOOL OF PUBLIC POLICY
department: LEE KUAN YEW SCHOOL OF PUBLIC POLICY
